result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
& Motion to Expand Time Limits for Filing Pretrial Motions
Telephone scheduling conference on September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court.  Attorney Allison A Markoski in court for Peter J. Raupp. State notes there is an Amended Information be addressed.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Atty Markoski stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for TSC.  Bond continues.  New SPD counsel will be appointed.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court.  Attorney Allison A Markoski in court for Peter J. Raupp. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Set over for arraignment.  State to file an amended information to have the bifercated and maximum penalties.
Arraignment scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:34 PM Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court with attorney Allison A Markoski.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Markoski states they would like a PH on 6/2/2022.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on March 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Not to operate MV w/any alcohol on board and must submit to chemical testing by law enforcement if requested. Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Not to go to taverns/bars/liquor stores or any business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute sobriety at all times.

ADDRESS INFO for Peter J. Raupp
Current: S2949 Highway 23, Reedsburg, WI 53959 United States  (Effective: 01-19-2022)
Prior: 232 Hillcrest Ln, Reedsburg, WI 53959

Status conference on March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date on March 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:44 PM Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Dolch.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Peter J. Raupp appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties. DE needs to apply for PD representation still.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests $2500.00 Cash bond. Atty. Dolch requests signature bond and no objection to conditions.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $2500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute Sobriety at all times.  No presence of any taverns/bars or liquor stores where the primary sale is alcohol.  No use or possession of alcohol.  Not to oper MV w/any alcohol on board,  and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement if requested. .  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
